sentence.Network_en: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们千方百计雇用那些性格上天生适合服务顾客的人。

sentence.Network_en: There is evidence to suggest that certain factors predispose some individuals to criminal behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 有证据表明，特定的因素会使某些人产生犯罪倾向。

sentence.Network_en: His modesty and generosity predispose people to like him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的谦虚和慷慨使得人们未经接触就喜欢他.

entry.def: If something predisposes you to think or behave in a particular way, it makes it likely that you will think or behave in that way.

example.ex: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well...
example.tran: 他们千方百计雇用那些性格上天生适合服务顾客的人。

example.ex: There is evidence to suggest that certain factors predispose some individuals to criminal behaviour.
example.tran: 有证据表明，特定的因素会使某些人产生犯罪倾向。

entry.tran: 使易感染，使易患（某种疾病）
entry.def: If something predisposes you to a disease or illness, it makes it likely that you will suffer from that disease or illness.

example.ex: ...a gene that predisposes people to alcoholism.

sentences.sentence: "This illness predisposes you to gain weight"

auth_sentence.content: Taste buds predispose mammals to choose tasty foods.
auth_sentence.res_content: Taste buds predispose mammals to choose tasty foods.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Taste buds predispose mammals to choose tasty foods.

auth_sentence.content: Unfortunately, less sudden demises predispose women to lengthier diseases of miserable deterioration.
auth_sentence.res_content: Unfortunately, less sudden demises predispose women to lengthier diseases of miserable deterioration.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unfortunately, less sudden demises predispose women to lengthier diseases of miserable deterioration.

auth_sentence.content: It's not suppose to really-, it doesn't predispose even to do good stuff.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's not suppose to really-, it doesn't predispose even to do good stuff.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's not suppose to really-, it doesn't predispose even to do good stuff.

means.word_mean: 使倾向于做；使易于患(病)

sentences.en: Cigarette advertising predisposes children to smoking.
sentences.cn: 烟草广告会引道儿童抽烟。

sentences.en: His lifestyle predisposed him to high blood pressure.
sentences.cn: 他的生活方式容易使他患高血压。

sentences.en: Certain people may be predisposed to mental illness.
